intro: Onosma tricerosperma, commonly known as the three-seeded onosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Tajikistan. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence. Onosma tricerosperma is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
